snippet: Labels on painkillers like ibuprofen that are taken by millions of Americans will be subtly changed to say that they cause an increased risk of heart attack and stroke.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration will strengthen warnings about risk of heart attack and stroke on labels for over-the-counter non-aspirin pain killers.
lead_paragraph: Labels on painkillers like ibuprofen that are taken by millions of Americans will be subtly changed to say that they cause an increased risk of heart attack and stroke.

headline.main: F.D.A. Is Set to Toughen Nonaspirin Warnings
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Is Set to Toughen Nonaspirin Warnings
